titleInfo.title: Influence of cotton plant population in the control of Striga hermonthica in maize under greenhouse condition

name.affiliation: Department of Plant Science, Institute for Agricultural Research, Ahmadu Bello University, P.M.B. 1044, Samaru, Zaria, Nigeria.
Department of Plant Science, Institute for Agricultural Research, Ahmadu Bello University, P.M.B. 1044, Samaru, Zaria, Nigeria.

mods.abstract: Effect of cotton (trap crop) plant population in the control of Striga hermonthica using a susceptible maize hybrid (test crop) was studied in 1998 and 1999 under greenhouse conditions in a complete randomized design with three replications. The treatment combination; cotton varieties (SAMCOT- 8, SAMCOT-10, TAMCOT-CAMD-E and TXCDP37HH-1-83) at 2, 4 and 6 population density/ pot significantly influence Striga count, days to Striga emergence, plant height, damage score and total maize dry weight. SAMCOT-8 at 2, 4 and 6 population density reduced Striga count and delayed Striga emergence, while TAMCOT- CAMD-E, SAMCOT-10 and SAMCOT-8 at high population density (4 and 6/pot) reduced maize damage score. Higher total maize dry weight was obtained in all treatment involving TAMCOT-CAMD-E than other treatment combination involving the rest cotton varieties. Low and non-significant effect of Striga damage on maize was recorded.
